snippet: The $2 billion resettlement plan, which would have resolved long-contested landownership claims, had been called ethnic cleansing by critics.
abstract: Israeli government shelves plan to resettle tens of thousands of Bedouin citizens in the Negev desert that had drawn international condemnation; plan spawned street demonstrations across the country and lost the support of lawmakers from the governing coalition as well.
lead_paragraph: The $2 billion resettlement plan, which would have resolved long-contested landownership claims, had been called ethnic cleansing by critics.

headline.main: Israel Shelves Plan to Move Bedouins Amid Outcry
headline.print_headline: Israel Shelves Plan to Move Bedouins Amid Outcry

keywords.value: Adalah, The Legal Center for Arab Minority Rights in Israel
keywords.name: organizations
